-- The history of Topaz --

The probable origin of the name topaz comes from the Sanskrit Tupas meaning fire. Known since Antiquity, topaz is mentioned in ancient texts and in particular in the Bible. It is associated with Saint-Mathieu who receives a topaz to illuminate the hearts of his people .

The greatest civilizations like the Egyptians appreciated this stone for its brilliance and used it as amulets of protection. The legend said that topaz drew its gloss reflections of Ra, the sun god .

Both the Greeks and the Romans also attributed topazes - especially yellows - to Apollo, god of light and sun.

Today, we know that topaz is a stone that extends over an infinity of shades and colors. There are also many symbols and myths around this stone. Even today, in India , it is sacred and guarantees longevity.
